title: Digital Analytics & Optimization Manager
content:
Lume is a 5-year-old fast growing ecommerce deodorant and personal care brand that’s transforming the way that humans do hygiene. We joined forces with Harry’s, another disruptive brand with great people and infrastructure, to accelerate our growth. We are a team of self-starters that roll up our sleeves and get it done. Our style is collaborative and very fast-paced so an adaptive personality is a must.The Role:
We are looking for a Digital Analytics & Optimization Manager. On the Digital Product team, this person will own our ecommerce conversion rate metrics across channels and own the strategy for our CRO program for both Lume and Mando. They will analyze website metrics to understand the performance of product mix, bundled products, site features, and promotions. This person is a Google Analytics power user and has expertise in Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and BI tools. 
We are looking for a self-starter with a hands-on mentality and a passion for storytelling. This person will work across Lume and Mando to provide data-backed, actionable insights to our team.
 
Your Day to Day:

Own conversion rate metrics for Lume and Mando, and the CRO (conversion rate optimization) program strategy.
Own the CRO roadmap; creating & gathering test ideas from across the organization, and effectively prioritizing those ideas based on complexity & likelihood for success.
Serve as the main point of contact for all requests around storefront key metrics, promotion performance, product mix, and e-commerce conversion.
Proactively, monitor and analyze our e-commerce business performance through conversion rate, user activity, website metrics, and product trends.
Support site merchandising in looking for trends in product conversions & interactions that guide product and bundle offering strategies.
Pull weekly metrics and draw insights from Google Analytics and Looker to establish benchmarks of success and to identify opportunities for improvement to share cross-functionally.
Build custom GA4 and Looker reports to provide deep-dive analysis into specific features, promotions, and tests.
Provide results from promotions to inform strategic decisions that will improve conversion and deal strategies.
Provide ad hoc insights around ongoing and future initiatives.

 
Who You Are:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data into clear actionable insights.
Highly familiar with LTV, CAC, ROAS, CVR, and other key business metrics.
Effective communication skills with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Extreme attention to detail and the ability to independently manage multiple projects with varying deadlines.
Advanced skills (2+ years) in Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Shopify Plus and BI Tools
Experience with SQL and Looker are a huge plus
Advanced skills in excel (macros, power query, pivots, etc.)

 
Who You’ll Work With:

Manage a team of technical CRO professionals (currently one individual, with team expansion planned for the future)
Report to Sr. Manager of Digital Product
Cross-functional partners across Performance Marketing, Consumer Insights, Engineering, and Creative.

This role can be done remotely, however there may be location constraints based on where Harry's is registered and able to employ individuals. Please work with your recruiter and your hiring manager to understand any location constraints. We are authorized and able to employ individuals in many, but not all states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where we are registered or able to employ individuals, you will not be eligible for employment. Please speak with your recruiter to learn more. 
#BI-Remote #LI-Remote
#LI-CT1 
We can’t quantify all of the intangible things we think you’ll love about working at Harry’s, like the exciting challenges we tackle, the smart and humble team you’ll get to work with, and our supportive and inclusive culture. That said, our salary ranges are based on paying competitively for our size and industry, and are one part of our total rewards package, which also includes a comprehensive set of benefits and our equity program. The base salary hiring range for this position is $110,000-$130,000, but the final compensation offer will ultimately be based on the candidate’s location, skill level and experience.  
 Lume is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, veteran status, sex, parental status, gender identity or expression, transgender status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetic information. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our company.

demographic_questions.description:
Please take a moment to self-identify via this voluntary survey. Individual responses collected from this survey:

  • Will not be accessible to anyone making hiring decisions with respect to this role 
  • Will have no bearing on your application or candidacy 

This data will be used exclusively for analytics-based reporting related to our Diversity & Inclusion efforts. This data helps further Harry’s mission to bring together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives as we strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together. We hope that you will choose to answer.

questions.label: Which racial and/or ethnic category best describes you?

answer_options.label: Alaskan Native / American Indian / Indigenous American / Native American
East Asian (inclusive of Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Mongolian, Tibetan, and Taiwanese)
South Asian (inclusive of Bangladeshi, Bhutanese, Indian, Nepali, Pakistani, and Sri Lankan)
Southeast Asian (inclusive of Burmese, Cambodian, Filipino, Hmong, Indonesian, Laotian, Malaysian, Mien, Singaporean, Thai, and Vietnamese)

questions.label: With which gender identity do you most identify?

answer_options.label: Non-Binary (Inclusive of bigender, agender, androgynous, gender fluid, gender non-conforming)
